channel.title: It's time for an update
channel.description: a series of blogposts, snippets and insights mostly related to web development, Sitefinity CMS and optimization tricks

image.title: It's time for an update
image.description: a series of blogposts, snippets and insights mostly related to web development, Sitefinity CMS and optimization tricks

item.title: Caching and Compression for Sitefinity v5 (2)
item.description: How to use web.config transformations to optimize different development scenario's by Jochem Bökkers

item.title: Caching and Compression for Sitefinity v5 (1)
item.description: How to setup caching and compression with IIS 7 and Sitefinity 5 by Jochem Bökkers

item.title: Sitefinity Boilerplate DeepDive
item.description: A detailed look at all the different elements that make up the Sitefinity Boilerplate project and how to tweak them to easily get you up and running within a few minutes.

item.title: Sitefinity Boilerplate
item.description: With recently Sitefinity Thunder being released, I thought it was time for a new approach and an easier way of starting a new Sitefinity project...

item.title: Finding the Sitefinity turbo-switch
item.description: A quick old-fashioned trick on how to dramatically improve local Sitefinity development when things are kind of sluggish.
